definition: to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to be willing to sacrifice everything one has (idiom)
to mess (sth) up/to foul up/to spoil
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to move a stone and stub one's toe/to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)
pinyin: ban1 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to hurt oneself by one's own doing/to boomerang/to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)
to pound the earth to make a building foundation

sentences.english: After that, everybody pelted snowballs at anybody who was riding the sled.
sentences.chinese: 那之後，每個人都對著坐雪橇滑下來的人砸雪球。

sentences.english: I double feet hair dint, the Huo ground plays white dress Human body side, the one punch hits to go out.
sentences.chinese: 我雙腳發力，霍地彈到白衣人身邊，一拳砸出去。

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it through the next-door-neighbor's window.
sentences.chinese: 你報答她，把鄰居的玻璃砸得稀里嘩啦。

sentences.english: He bellowed in pain when the hammer came down on his finger.
sentences.chinese: 當鐵錘砸到手指時，他痛得大叫。

sentences.english: Last season was a humiliating homecoming.
sentences.chinese: 上賽季榮歸故里是演砸了。

sentences.english: But I did bad in the Final Exam.
sentences.chinese: 但我卻在期末考試中考砸了。

sentences.english: Is a , have already dripped on the floor, Grey UGG Boots, almost hit in his instep.
sentences.chinese: 一聲，已經掉在地上，差點就砸到他的腳面上。

sentences.english: Who has the brain and money to stage this smash-and-grab?
sentences.chinese: 誰有腦力和財力策劃這場砸了就搶的案子？

sentences.english: I blew it on that last exam.
The streets were littered with stones and bottles hurled at the soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 街道上到處撒落着砸向士兵的石頭和瓶子。

sentences.english: So, I got the refrigerator and pushed it over the balcony and it crushed him.
sentences.chinese: 一氣之下，我搬出冰箱，推下陽臺，砸到了他身上。

sentences.english: The next salvos were right on target.
sentences.chinese: 第二波炮火就準確砸在目標上了。

sentences.english: Once the job hits the floor, it’s off to the races.
sentences.chinese: 一旦任務砸到車間，那就是一場封閉的賽跑了。

sentences.english: It was extremely dangerous. We were nearly hit by the stone.
sentences.chinese: 剛纔好險，石頭差點砸中我們。

sentences.english: Some were so furious that they attacked his car. The crowd was dispersed three hours later.
sentences.chinese: 有些憤怒的羣衆便開始砸他的車，吸引了近千人圍觀。

sentences.english: At this moment, hailstones happen to thump on the rooftops .
sentences.chinese: 此刻，突然下起了冰雹，乒乒乓乓地砸在屋頂上。

definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
